intro: Sisymbrium sagittatum, commonly known as narrowleaf mustard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along streambanks.
